definition: Words of benevolence apply universally (idiom). Humanitarian expressions benefit all.
humane/kernel
words/speech/to say/to talk
surname Li
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
old variant of 博[bo2]
extensive/ample/rich/obtain/aim/to win/to get/plentiful/to gamble
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
assistance that one gets from another
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
out of one's mind
Danger appears where many harmful factors exist. (idiom)
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
lit. to live on dry provisions and wild herbs (idiom)/fig. to live in abject poverty
to bear one's own responsibilities and not pass them to others (idiom)
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
to bide one's time, waiting for an opportunity to stage a comeback in public life (idiom)
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
a cut above/top quality
see 騎驢找驢|骑驴找驴[qi2 lu:2 zhao3 lu:2]
lit. like stepping on a tiger's tail or spring ice (idiom)/fig. extremely dangerous situation
